comments.commentBody:
"These truths are self evident...", except to the modern faux conservative who chooses to be a Russian Stooge instead of American.

I bet a dollar you argued that there were WMDs in Iraq too.

Sophisticated dialects espousing grandiose positions based on the notion that we should "shake things up" are clearly driven by Russian propaganda.

You are a stooge, and little donnie is a traitor.
Willfully uninformed.

You lost me with your reference to Trump's Miss America's contestants and their "world peace" remarks. Within the context of the dangerous world in which we live the inference is both churlish and childish. And no amount of all caps words won't make it so.

You would do well to actually get the facts straight. I think you'll find that Trump at one time owned a Miss Universe franchise.

But of course as you rant on about a guy called Obama whose briefcase you couldn't begin to carry, the shallowness of your comments get more and more pronounced.

We were damned lucky to have folks like Fried and Obama elect to spend their lives in public service. They both understood the power of our American ideals, the political core of which seem to have escaped you.

A central element to those American political fundamentals involve your right to have an opinion and openly express it.

In Trump's America that notion is very much under siege. Which is why, using the GRU playbook, he refers to the press as the "enemy of the people."

He only values personal loyalty. So clearing out any State department "deadwood" has nothing to do with principles or policies. It has only to do with him.

I'm surprised that that isn't obvious to you.

But as my late mother would have said, "There we are."

Your problem is in your first sentence, to claim, "there is only one reality," as if that means Trump is somehow not accountable to citizens of this country. It's true there's only one "reality" (interesting that Trump and his supporters also believe in "alternative facts" - that sounds a bit like an alternate reality to me). But there are many, many facets to "reality", and to act as if Trump being POTUS puts to rest all other discussion, all controversy as to how he's conducting himself is ridiculous. The fact he *is* POTUS means he will be held to account for everything he does (or does not) do. That's kind of the point of being "Commander in Chief"...!

As to what he's "delivered," so far mainly confusion and great anxiety on the part of at least half this country and many others. Stop being so childish as to act as if this is some demented game you keep score of. Trump (and you) may think this is a game -for the rest of us, it most definitely is not.

This column is absolutely about contempt, contempt for reality. I could write a column about this column but let's stick to one sentence, does this
"pundit" actually believe that the US was "a new nation conceived in liberty with the notion that all men are created equal." ? This sounds like the slop served up in elementary school history books.

As for no longer being a "white man's republic", then how do you explain this propagandist having a job as a writer.
As ghastly as it gets.

All legislators in the federal government--house and senate--take the same oath. So why do so many of them seem to not understand just what they took an oath for?
We need to make them understand what their oath meant. That means calling, writing and appearing at their offices; making them understand that FIRST they are Americans. Way down the list is the fact that they belong to a particular party.

Way to go, Jan! That Looking-Glass comment "the press should reference all their erroneous information" is a shoo-in for nonsense of the week kudos.

I can see it now: "Donald Trump is a big fat liar. This is erroneous information we got from Mr. and Ms. Fulano of Entre Pinto y Valdemoro. Sincerely, The New York Times."

That do ya?
He turned the process into a reality TV show. And the Republican party let him trash it!

Brilliant column, Mr. Cohen. It captures exactly the contempt I am sorry to say I feel for our President. Please continue to work to uphold the oath you took when you became a citizen of the US. And all of us, we need to continue to look for ways defend our country from the puny, stifling vision for America of Donald Trump and his stooges.

Can Paul Ryan and Mitch McConnell please read this?
See that, LeoK?  They included your submission even though you had absolutely nothing of interest to say.

Winston in "1984" muses about the regime he first thinks that only the "Proles" can change it,but then realizes that they are too beaten down so that they only think about filling their bellies and will never form an opposition. Orwell was right.

"A nation gets the government it deserves."

On the contrary, we are ‘a new nation, conceived in liberty and dedicated to the proposition that all men are created equal.’ ” And so, “that rough sense of equality and opportunity, embedded in us, informed the way that we brought our American power to the world, America’s Grand Strategy. We have, imperfectly, and despite detours and retreat along the way, sought to realize a better world for ourselves and for others, for we understood that our prosperity and our values at home depend on that prosperity and those values being secure as far as possible in a sometimes dark world.”

Sure we did Roger? Who orchestrated Disaster Capitalism: Shock Doctrine?
Who orchestrated coup around the world? State Department of the US?

Yes, "contempt" is what Trump shows in his every tweet. Worst yet, his contempt extends to the core American values of democracy and freedom of the press and, in the Oval Office, he threatens our way of life more than any foreign enemy possibly could. Trump is un-American.

But there is a more comprehensive understanding of Trump, and that comes from the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, the source book for the psychiatric diagnosis and treatment of mental illness.

A letter written by several eminent psychiatrists to then President Obama, stated their grave concerns that President elect Trump met the DSM criteria for narcissistic personality disorder. While one may question psychoanalysis at a distance, Trump is so very public with his uncensored thoughts that his personality flaws are out there for all to see.

Since the psychiatrists' letter has been published in print media, I went to the DSM source and, indeed, Trump shows us everyday, the several behaviors that are needed to make this diagnosis. It will serve all citizens well to read the DSM criteria and realize our President is, by professional criteria, truly not fit for office. With the power of the US government in his grasp, he is a very dangerous man.

Vox.....as a former psychologist, I concur with the DSM diagnosis of personality disorder but must add an addendum. Most patients demonstrate several features of various personality disorders, not just one.

For example, antisocial personality disorder often mixes with borderline personality and others.

There have been other presidents with serious psychological disorders who have functioned fairly well including Lincoln's severe depressive episodes. The trick is to determine if the specific disorder with Trump renders him in affective as a president.

I believe the answer is yes. It will be necessary for republicans to show the patriotism and courage to step forward and remove the president from office.

The country deserves nothing less than this honesty and dedication from its public servants.

and our press has not been free press for a very long time. A bunch of oligarchs own the press and work in their own best interest. The bunch is really not that big of a bunch.

The press put Trump into the highest office in the land with the help of dem party and pundits like yourself by anointing Hillary Clinton. Buyers remorse.

This is the last stage of a democracy where it turns inward and destroys itself. The election of a president who is not only unqualified but also is not interested in doing the job he was given by the citizens.

Contempt is a symptom of disloyalty toward the country itself. The result of contempt is lack of enertia and, in Trump's case, a refusal to even hire those who will run the country.

Bannon's deconstruction of America is showing up in all aspects of Trump's administration.

The the list can go on and on. Contempt for compassion. Contempt for human decency. Contempt for knowledge and wisdom. Contempt for promises made, and left to gather dust.

This is a contemptible President who riles against fake news and embraces fake truths instead.

Today we hear Trump plans to separate illegal refugee mothers from their children as they enter the US. What next? Lineups for the shower? Let us identify the contemptible minds that author these diabolical plans. It seems there is a Goebbels lurking somewhere in the White House.

I can't get over the fact that SO MANY Trump team members were meeting with this or that high-level Russian WHILE knowing (as any political operative would known at the time) that they were meeting with a foreign enemy who was AT THAT VERY MOMENT attacking our political system.  Those meetings, and the news from David Cay Johnston about "The Russian Fertilizer King's" 20-some-odd visits to large and small city airports at exactly the same time as Trump's plane was there.  This smells more and more like a grand conspiracy.

Make Moscow and Pyongyang Great Again

TRUMP 2017

What keeps getting lost in all of the "meetings" Trump's people had with the Russians, the critical contact is being underplayed, and that is the one in which NSA Flynn, on the very same day that President Obama expelled 35 Russian diplomats and closed two of their residences, seems to have soothed the Russian ambassador with a promise that things would be different in a few days, that is, when Trump took office.  Putin uncharacteristically did not retaliate. That looks like the smoking gun to me and should be emphasized in every story.

Our government has been accused of breaking a borrowed bowl and tells us 1. they never borrowed the bowl, 2. the bowl was broken when they got it, and 3. the bowl was in perfect condition when they returned it. Truth is irrelevant.

http://www.rollingstone.com/culture/features/the-last-confession-of-e-ho...

I found this article on Watergate Co-Conspirator E. Howard Hunt. It shows how he easily lied to everyone, about everything related to Watergate and his neck deep his involvement . He lied to everyone including his wife and kids...Before his death he felt like he was betrayed in that he was just "following orders" from "the top". He lied in the days long before email. the internet, digital access to records, and it took longer to piece it all together. But he continued to lie. All the way to prison.

Ok, lets investigate also the Clintons dealings after transferring the classified information into a private server, including state dep. Classified. The Saudi dealing WikiLeaks and George Soros involvement in our elections. His cartel organization of legalizing drugs and destroying our families. His manipulative stock markets and throwing billions into politics. Please investigate everything no stone unturned. the American people have the right to know.
I'm having burnout.  People met who's job is meet people and collect as many contacts as possible.  I'm no Putin or Trump fan, but it's getting tiring and we're getting too paranoid.

Hillary Clinton: "Go ahead everyone, look at Benghazi!" Nothing illegal found.

Hillary Clinton: "Go ahead everyone, look at my emails!" Nothing illegal found.

Nixon and Trump, deny, deny, deny, avoid, avoid, avoid. If you work hard to keep the FBI away, you are SO guilty. Go see the great conversation the New Yorker had with John Dean comparing Nixon and Trump.
